title: Apple WebKit attr() Invalid Attribute Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Apple WebKit. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page.
The specific flaw exists in the handling of attr() functions in a CSS content object. When a large numerical value is passed as the argument to the attr() function, a memory corruption will occur which can be leveraged to execute arbitrary coder under the context of the current user.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3613
timeline:
2009-03-26 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2009-06-08 - Coordinated public release of advisory
